## Useful Info

**Khufu the Undying Pharaoh** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") mummy. He has all the spells of a [royal mummy](/Royal_mummy "Royal mummy"), including [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), with extra [HP](/HP "HP"), the ability to [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), and the worst [death curse](/Death_curse "Death curse") in the game. He is accompanied by an entourage of [mummies](/Mummy_\(monster\) "Mummy (monster)") and [royal mummies](/Royal_mummy "Royal mummy").

## Location

- [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")
- [The Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb")

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                                  |                                                                                                             |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Summon Emperor Scorpions](/Summon_Emperor_Scorpions "Summon Emperor Scorpions") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                         |
| Slot2       | [Smiting](/Smiting "Smiting") (7-17)                                             | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                         |
| Slot3       | [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment")                      | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                         |
| Slot4       | [Summon Scarabs](/Summon_Scarabs "Summon Scarabs")                               | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                         |
| Slot5       | [Blink](/Blink "Blink")                                                          | [Emergency flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Unless you manage to lure away individual mummies very carefully, you'll be facing an army of extremely dangerous monsters that can injure you no matter what you do. Bring as much torment resistance as you can get to avoid being decimated in the first few rounds. A [scroll of blinking](/Scroll_of_blinking "Scroll of blinking") will help you get out of their [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight") quickly should everything start to fall apart.
- A [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") grants torment immunity, poison resistance for the scorpions, and a significant bonus to HP, but also renders you immobile. In the sorts of areas Khufu can be found, being unable to flee from dangerous opponents can be lethal. Try to use this strategy in an area you have already cleared, so reinforcements don't stumble upon you mid-fight, and most certainly do not lignify in the open where 8 enemies can surround you.
- Try to lure Khufu into a narrow corridor (or better yet, a [kill hole](/Kill_hole "Kill hole"), though you probably won't be able to create your own in the Crypt or Tomb). Doing so cuts down on the number of reinforcements he can call in, as well as how many of his entourage will be able to reach you.
- Khufu is a good target for attacks that can bypass the front lines. Piercing attacks like [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") or [bolt spells](/Bolt_spell "Bolt spell"), smite-targeted attacks like [Portal Projectile](/Portal_Projectile "Portal Projectile") or some gods' [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations"), [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") to reach past his summons...
  - If you have a [condenser vane](/Condenser_vane "Condenser vane") and some Evocations training, this is the time to use it. Bathing Khufu's army in a sea of flames is best, but freezing clouds will at least soften them up a little. For those with extensive Evocations training, a blast of thunderclouds or especially [acid](/Acid "Acid") will also prove effective (though poison and excruciating misery will be useless).
- [Silence](/Silence "Silence") stops up his spellcasting capabilities very effectively, assuming you can get close enough to him.
- Upon killing him, you have a great chance to be [slowed](/Slow "Slow") or tormented. Beware of nearby undead!

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Khufu had the [Tomb of Doroklohe](/Tomb_of_Doroklohe "Tomb of Doroklohe") instead of [Blink](/Blink "Blink").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Khufu had [Summon Undead](/Summon_Undead "Summon Undead") instead of [Summon Scarabs](/Summon_Scarabs "Summon Scarabs").

An incredibly powerful emperor on the way to godhood. He died quite some time ago, but he sees no reason why that should stop him.

“And then I looked farther, beyond the pallid line of the sands, and I saw a Pyramid of gold, the wonder Khufu had built. As a golden wonder it saluted me, as a golden thing it greeted me, as a golden miracle I shall remember it.”
-Robert Hichens, _The Spell of Egypt_

  • 2 Location

Useful Info

Khufu the Undying Pharaoh is a unique mummy. He has all the spells of a royal mummy, including Symbol of Torment, with extra HP, the ability to Blink, and the worst death curse in the game. He is accompanied by an entourage of mummies and royal mummies.

Location

  • The Crypt
  • The Tomb

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Summon Emperor Scorpions Wizard flag
Slot2 Smiting (7-17) Wizard flag
Slot3 Symbol of Torment Wizard flag
Slot4 Summon Scarabs Wizard flag
Slot5 Blink Emergency flag,
Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Unless you manage to lure away individual mummies very carefully, you'll be facing an army of extremely dangerous monsters that can injure you no matter what you do. Bring as much torment resistance as you can get to avoid being decimated in the first few rounds. A scroll of blinking will help you get out of their line of sight quickly should everything start to fall apart.
  • A potion of lignification grants torment immunity, poison resistance for the scorpions, and a significant bonus to HP, but also renders you immobile. In the sorts of areas Khufu can be found, being unable to flee from dangerous opponents can be lethal. Try to use this strategy in an area you have already cleared, so reinforcements don't stumble upon you mid-fight, and most certainly do not lignify in the open where 8 enemies can surround you.
  • Try to lure Khufu into a narrow corridor (or better yet, a kill hole, though you probably won't be able to create your own in the Crypt or Tomb). Doing so cuts down on the number of reinforcements he can call in, as well as how many of his entourage will be able to reach you.
  • Khufu is a good target for attacks that can bypass the front lines. Piercing attacks like javelins or bolt spells, smite-targeted attacks like Portal Projectile or some gods' Invocations, Polearms to reach past his summons...
    • If you have a condenser vane and some Evocations training, this is the time to use it. Bathing Khufu's army in a sea of flames is best, but freezing clouds will at least soften them up a little. For those with extensive Evocations training, a blast of thunderclouds or especially acid will also prove effective (though poison and excruciating misery will be useless).
  • Silence stops up his spellcasting capabilities very effectively, assuming you can get close enough to him.
  • Upon killing him, you have a great chance to be slowed or tormented. Beware of nearby undead!

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Khufu had the Tomb of Doroklohe instead of Blink.
  • Prior to 0.27, Khufu had Summon Undead instead of Summon Scarabs.
